abstracts.cdata!:
This Environmental Assessment deals with
            the Bali Urban Infrastructure Program (BUIP), which consists
            of urban physical infrastructure projects and services in
            the sub-sectors of water supply, urban roads, human waste
            water sanitation, solid waste management, market
            infrastructure improvement, village improvement and urban
            drainage and flood control. Possible positive environmental
            impacts from the project include: improved public health,
            hygiene, and safety; decreased road noise; and improved
            traffic patterns. Possible negative impacts and their
            mitigation measures include: a) water demand increase
            combined with an irrigation conflict, reduced groundwater
            level, runoff possibilities, and increased waste water
            amount - mitigated by reduced water speed, prompt
            replantation, infiltration ditches or settlement basins,
            careful water source and intake location selection,
            underground water transport piping placed parallel to roads,
            and sludge disposal at final site to avoid river
            contamination; b) soil erosion and pollution - mitigated by
            replanting and separate collection of clippings from dry
            waste; c) resettlement of populace - mitigated by a
            resettlement plan; d) noise and disturbance - mitigated by
            locating markets away from densely populated areas and sound
            barrier construction; e) reduced safety in rural areas;
            mitigated by provision of safe crossings, signaling, and
            speed limits; f) air quality, pollution and increased odor -
            mitigated by use of vegetation to filter dust, seal dirt
            access roads, use of closed sanitation treatment process,
            closed garbage vans, and dump coverage, centralized
            incineration and green zone creation; g) interference with
            local drainage pattern and ground water; mitigated by
            special attention to material and methods of sewers and
            septic tanks construction, systematic inspections; selection
            of dump sites above ground water level and covering dumps to
            prevent rainwater infiltration; and h) flora and fauna
            damage- mitigated by minimizing road cross section,
            construction of animal crossings, and speed limits or fencing.
